{"id":859010231,"question_id":2,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"1 year, 7 months","timestamp":1670911971,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"150 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/859010231/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"13.9 MB","code":"# Definition for singly-linked list.\n# class ListNode:\n#     def __init__(self, val=0, next=None):\n#         self.val = val\n#         self.next = next\nclass Solution:\n    def addTwoNumbers(self, l1: Optional[ListNode], l2: Optional[ListNode]) -> Optional[ListNode]:\n      num1 = ''\n      num2 = ''\n\n      while l1:\n        num1 = str(l1.val) + num1\n        l1 = l1.next\n\n      while l2:\n          num2 = str(l2.val) + num2\n          l2 = l2.next\n\n      num = int(num1) + int(num2)\n      arr = list(str(num))\n\n      l =  ListNode(arr[len(arr) - 1], None)\n      curr = None\n      prev = l\n\n      for i in range(len(arr) - 2, -1, -1):\n          curr = ListNode(arr[i], None)\n          prev.next = curr\n          prev = prev.next\n\n      return l","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
